alert.note: Alert for Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 11:48AM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville affecting Weber County. .Recently warm temperatures will continue to result in melting snowpack and increased river flows. Minor flooding is ongoing along the South Fork of the Ogden River near Huntsville ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.6 feet (992 cfs), low lying areas near the banks of the South Fork of the Ogden River below Causey Reservoir through the town of Huntsville will receive minor flooding. At 5.5 feet (1599 cfs), low lying areas adjacent to the South Fork of the Ogden River below Causey Reservoir through the town of Huntsville will receive moderate flood damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 4.4 feet (890 cfs). - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening and continue rising to a crest of 4.7 feet (1051 cfs) late tonight. The river will oscillate above flood stage over the next few days, with a peak of 5.1 feet (1316 cfs) late Thursday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 4.6 feet (992). &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
